sentences.english: The children had glowing cheeks after race.
sentences.chinese: 孩子跑完步臉蛋兒紅通通的。

sentences.english: Up to that moment she had never thought of her face.
sentences.chinese: 她直到現在，還從來沒有想到過自己臉蛋兒的模樣。

sentences.english: I kissed her cheek as she turned it to me.
sentences.chinese: 她把臉蛋兒轉過來時，我吻了一下。

sentences.english: She has a very nice face. But she is very thin.
sentences.chinese: 她的臉蛋兒很漂亮，但她很瘦。

sentences.english: Elizabeth blushed and blushed again with shame and vexation.
sentences.chinese: 伊麗莎白又羞又惱，臉蛋兒紅了又紅。

sentences.english: He had a red face and a little mouth.
sentences.chinese: 它有一張紅紅的臉蛋兒，小小的嘴巴。

definition: (of a woman) to have nice curves/buxom/shapely
(slang) (usu. of a woman) sb who looks stunning from behind/sb who has a great figure but not necessarily an attractive face/abbr. to 背殺|背杀[bei4 sha1]
armpit/also pr. [ge1 zhi5 wo1]/also written 夾肢窩|夹肢窝[ga1 zhi5 wo1]
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
to leak (of air)/to go flat (of a tire)/to vent one's anger
variant of 腳趾|脚趾[jiao3 zhi3]
lit. in the eyes of a lover appears 西施[Xi1 shi1] (idiom); fig. beauty is in the eye of the beholder
pinyin: qing2 ren2 yan3 li3 chu1 Xi1 shi1
